xt:extension.xt:name: TEI Facsimile Plugin
xt:extension.xt:description:
A plugin that helps marking zones for a digital facsimile. After installation, if you want to quickly test it, you can just click Image Markup Sample on the toolbar. This will automatically perform the following steps on some sample files. If you want to use your own files, you must:
Go to Window->Show View and click on Image-Markup
Open a TEI document that contains facsimile information.
In the newly open editor, select an image name (for example Bovelles-49r.png) and press Open Selected in the Image-Markup view.
Supported features:
If you place yourself in a zone element inside the document, that element will be painted with a different color.
If you right click on a zone in image view, you can either delete it (and will reflect in the editor) or copy it and then paste it in the document.
You can use the mouse to draw a new rectangle over the image. Then right click and copy its coordinates to paste them in the editor.
You can resize an existing rectangle from one of its corners.
Known limitations (which can be addressed with some Java skills and free time):
All zone elements are being rendered. Ideally only the zone elements from the surface element with the loaded image should be rendered.
New zone elements that are manually inserted in the document will not be rendered automatically. You'll have to reload the image.
